snippet: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos faces a deadlock over proposed demands by Greece’s foreign lenders to reduce private-sector wages in exchange for aid the country needs to prevent default.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Lucas Papademos faces his most difficult test when his three-month-old government reaches an impasse over proposed demands by the country's foreign lenders to drastically reduce private-sector wages in exchange for the aid the country needs to prevent default; news media is flooded with rumors that Papademos has threatened to resign over the issue.

byline.contributor: Landon Thomas Jr. contributed reporting from London, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos faces a deadlock over proposed demands by Greece’s foreign lenders to reduce private-sector wages in exchange for aid the country needs to prevent default.

headline.seo: Greek Premier Is Tested in Impasse Over Pay Cuts
headline.main: Greek Premier Faces Impasse Over Demand to Cut Private Wages
headline.print_headline: Greek Premier Faces Impasse Over Demand to Cut Private Wages
